function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Trans-disciplinary health science research must be prioritized to develop a universal response to COVID-19","Impact":"Without prioritizing trans-disciplinary research, there may be a lack of comprehensive understanding of the pandemic and limited development of effective responses","Mitigation":"Promote collaboration between different scientific disciplines and integrate knowledge from various fields to address the complexity of the pandemic","Technologies":"Data analytics, communication platforms for collaboration, online research tools","People":"Health researchers, public health professionals","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies"},{"Description":"Extensive research is needed to understand the COVID-19 crisis life cycle and its causes and consequences","Impact":"Failure to understand the full cycle of the crisis and its causes may lead to inadequate preparation and ineffective response to future pandemics","Mitigation":"Conduct long-term research to gather evidence and insights on the life cycle, causes, and consequences of the COVID-19 crisis","Technologies":"Data analytics, modeling and simulation software, online research platforms","People":"Health researchers, public health agencies, policymakers","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies"},{"Description":"Research studies are needed to explore the interconnection of climate change to the development of the virus and its potential environmental factors","Impact":"Lack of understanding the environmental factors influencing virus diffusion may hinder the development of strategies to mitigate future pandemics","Mitigation":"Conduct interdisciplinary research to examine the relationship between climate change and virus development, and identify potential environmental factors influencing virus diffusion","Technologies":"Climate modeling, environmental monitoring technologies, data analytics","People":"Environmental scientists, health researchers, public health agencies","Owner":"Research institutions, environmental agencies"}]}
